frameDefinitions: A concept, Concept_1, is related causally or collocationally to another concept, Concept_2 by means of some evidence.
A Total has a Part, either  as a member of an aggregate or as  a constituent part of a simple entity.
Using Evidence, which may or may not be expressed, a Cognizer recognizes or proves that Concept1 is associated causally or collocationally with another concept, Concept2.
A mutual social and personal relationship that keeps people involved in each other's lives comprises a Connection of Individual1 to Individual2 or between Individuals.
In this frame a Theme moves in a certain Direction which is often determined by gravity or other natural, physical forces.
A Concept_1 is related to Concept_2 by some Evidence.
frameExamples: They wanted to strengthen their family <t>ties</t>.
The single remaining piece of evidence <t>linked</t> Kirov the tailor to Kirov the dissident activist.
listRoleDefinitions: The concept which is linked to <fen>Concept_2</fen>.  Generally expressed as the external argument.
The concept which is tied to <fen>Concept_1</fen>.  Generally expressed as a PP complement.
The two concepts expressed jointly.
A complex entity, either an aggregate or a unit, of which a <fen>Part</fen>,  a constituent or a component, is specified.
A component or constituent that is specified to form part of the <fen>Total</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Total</fen> includes the <fen>Part</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Total</fen> includes the <fen>Part</fen>.
<fen>Concept1</fen> is the phenomenon which is believed to be related to <fen>Concept2</fen>.
The phenomenon which is believed to be linked to Concept1.
The sentient entity that recognizes the causal connection.
The phenomena which are believed to be related.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> make the connection.
The location where the Cognizer makes the connection.
<fen>Individuals</fen> have a <fen>Connection</fen> with each other.
<fen>Individual1</fen> has a social <fen>Connection</fen> to <fen>Individual_2</fen>.
<fen>Individual2</fen> has a relationship to <fen>Individual_1</fen>.
<fen>Connection</fen> is the personal relationship between <fen>Individuals</fen> that keeps them involved in each other's lives.
This role identifies the general <fen>Area</fen> in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular or not to consist of a single, linear path.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is the location the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up in (often unintentionally).
<fen>Path</fen> refers to (a part of) the ground over which the <fen>Theme</fen> travels  or to a landmark past which the <fen>Theme</fen> travels.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the entity that changes location.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the location the <fen>Theme</fen> occupies before the Motion occurs.
The direction of motion of the <fen>Theme</fen>.  <fen>Direction</fen> characterizes the <fen>Path</fen> of motion according to some system of orientation, most often that imposed by gravity.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the Motion occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where motion specified by <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen> occurs.
The concept which is linked to <fen>Concept_2</fen>.
The concept which is tied to <fen>Concept_1</fen>.
The phenomenon that points to or proves the connection between <fen>Concept_1</fen> and <fen>Concept_2</fen>. Generally expressed as an external.
The two concepts expressed jointly.
listRoleExamples: The larger album includes <fex>designs for his house at Whitehall</fex>.
<fex>Last year</fex> the recognized departments included the Russian and East European Institute, and the Office of International Programs.
<fex>In California</fex>, the category excludes minors and the mentally ill.
Soot-contaminated snow falls <fex>in Slovakia's mountainous regions</fex>.
The rivals both fell backwards <fex>into empty space</fex>.
The boys plummeted <fex>down the stairs</fex> into the basement.
In 1977, <fex> Nigel</fex> plunged to his death in his car on a mountain road in southern France.
The man toppled <fex>from the passenger seat</fex> into the road.
I hope your egg does n't fall <fex>down</fex> .
<fex>In 1977</fex> Nigel plunged to his death in his car on a mountain road in southern France.
<fex>In the kitchen</fex>, the towel dropped onto the floor.
High death rates among smokers connect <fex>cigarettes</fex> with disease.
Skid marks on the street connects my neighbor's car <fex>to my broken mailbox</fex>.
Ample evidence is able to connect <fex>the two</fex>.
